description: ACAN – Senior Programmer/Software Developer - WebCIMS 1. Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN) An ACAN is a public notice indicating to the supplier community that a department or agency intends to award a contract for goods, services or construction to a pre-identified supplier, thereby allowing other suppliers to signal their interest in bidding, by submitting a statement of capabilities. If no supplier submits a statement of capabilities that meets the requirements set out in the ACAN, on or before the closing date stated in the ACAN, the contracting officer may then proceed with the award to the pre-identified supplier. 2. Definition of the requirement The Military Grievances External Review Committee (MGERC) has a requirement for informatics professional services to assist in the development, support, and maintenance of various computer based applications, more specifically, the Case Management System (CMS) using Web-based Correspondence & Information Management System (WebCIMS 7).  WebCIMS, an Information Management commercially of the shelf system has been used by MGERC since April 1st, 2002. There is a continuing requirement for modifications and maintenance of the CMS application using WebCIMS. In 2017, MGERC moved to WebCIMS version 7. Going forward there will be a number of modifications required to enhance existing reports and modules and develop Web Reports and modules as requested by the Project Authority. SCOPE OF WORK / DELIVERABLES MGERC requires the services of one (1) dedicated senior programmer/software developer. The proposed resource will be required to perform, as a minimum, the following tasks: a) Modify the CMS WebCIMS application and enhance and develop Web Reports and modules where necessary and appropriate as requested by the Project Authority; b) Develop a recommended implementation plan for each of the modifications to the WebCIMS CMS application; c) Produce a problem resolution report and system documentation, showing detailed analysis and documenting the root cause of problem, corrective action taken and precautionary activities or safeguards to mitigate future incidences of the same problems.
full_summary:
**Job Title:** Senior Programmer/Software Developer - WebCIMS
**Reference Number:** PW-22-01012139
**Publication Date:** November 2 2022
**Closing Date:** November 17, 2022 at 4:00 PM EST


## Job Description

The Canadian government's Military Grievances External Review Committee (MGERC) is seeking a Senior Programmer/Software Developer to assist in the development, support, and maintenance of their Case Management System (CMS) using Web-based Correspondence and Information Management System (WebCIMS).

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Modify the CMS WebCIMS application and enhance and develop Web Reports and modules as necessary.
* Develop a recommended implementation plan for each modification to the WebCIMS CMS application.
* Produce a problem resolution report and system documentation, including detailed analysis and corresponding actions.
* Support and guide the designated WebCIMS Administrators in the management of the CMS WebCIMS application.
* Integrate WebCIMS with GCDocs for the retention and disposition of documents in case files.

**Requirements:**

* A valid WebCIMS 5 Development Engineer Certificate
* A minimum of 10 years of experience as a Programmer/Software developer
* A minimum of 5 years of experience in conducting analysis, documenting user requirements, and implementing and supporting clients/users in a development or operational environment working with Correspondence or Case Management Systems using WebCIMS 5 or greater.
* A minimum of 5 years of experience developing and customizing Web interfaces using ASP, Java, Java Script, VB, and VBScript codes and Net Codes.
* A minimum of 5 years of experience supporting SQL Server 2008/ 2012/2014 databases.

## Spatial Requirements

The contractor shall work at various locations as required by MGERC. The Work shall be performed from April 1st, 2023 until March 31st, 2024 (up to 40 days in the fiscal year 2023-2024) on an “as when required” basis.

## Schedule and Budget

* The period of performance shall be up to 40 days in the fiscal year 2023-2024.
* The estimated value of the contract is $160,000.00 (GST/HST extra).

## Contact

For any inquiries or to submit a statement of capabilities, please contact:

Kaylah St. Pierre
Agente d'approvisionnement et d'administration
Services financiers et administratifs
Services corpor
